programmes.show_description: The group has now been reduced from 14 to 11 as brutal hikes and treacherous crossings prove too much for some. After they grapple with who should leave the mountain at the first vote-off, the Mountain's Keeper forces their hand yet again with a difficult decision that has everyone feeling vulnerable. Will the ensuing elimination see the group vote with their heads or their hearts?

With the government overhauling planning rules and pledging to 'go further than ever before' to deliver 370,000 new homes a year, what will this mean for where new housing is built, and for the quality of homes across Britain? Tom Barton reveals planning breaches on estates around the country, and speaks to homeowners who have experienced devastating flooding

Ainsley Harriott heads to the historic Graycliff restaurant to meet master chocolatiers, before enjoying some Asian-Bahamian fusion with chef Ariana Victoria at Aquafire. He then experiences the cocktail scene with the island's Mr Mix before making a supersweet seaside bake
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programmes.show_name: Gary Barlow's Wine Tour: South Africa
programmes.show_description: The Take That star explores the country, searching for the most authentic, accessible and exciting food and drink experiences South Africa has to offer. He begins his adventure by meeting friend and fellow musician Eliot Kennedy in Franschhoek, heading to the Spier Wine Farm for a crash course in the country's most celebrated grape varieties before sampling some classic South African food, cooked on a braai
Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features
Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.
Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more
The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy
The key headlines from the day so far

David Dickinson and his team are in Cirencester in Gloucestershire, where the owners of a horse hoof match box think it's worth next to nothing, but they end up selling it for hundreds of pounds. And the seller of an Italian vase bought online learns a tough lesson in the saleroom

Quiz hosted by Ranvir Singh in which Gareth and Chris, Sally and Les, and Annika and Robert take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis. They attempt to answer general knowledge questions and confusing conundrums, with only one team making it through to the high-stakes final with a chance to win a cash prize

Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Bradley Walsh presents as Will from Norfolk, Stuart from Walsall, Zoe from Hull and Eithne from London pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programmes.show_name: STV News at Six and Weather
programmes.show_description: Including regional weather forecast
By the Scottish National Party
A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world
Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings
Sarah urges Cain to listen to reason, while Bear is determined and Joe encourages Graham
Will and Sam attempt to keep each other onside, Carl reports Ronnie for assault, Brian refuses to reinstate Lily, and Tim gets jealous of Ben and Steve's blossoming friendship

Alphy and Geordie realise they miss each other and stop sulking as Keating invites his colleague to meet Fascist Wilbur Church, who has been invited to speak at the student union. There have been attempts on Wilbur's life wherever he goes, but it's Church's wife who opens a parcel bomb addressed to him when one gets through. Drama, starring Robson Green and Rishi Nair, with Al Weaver, who also directed
A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programmes.show_name: Online Reviews: Can You Trust Them? - Tonight
programmes.show_description: Online reviews can play a crucial role in guiding spending decisions, but how much can we really believe the glowing praise and five-star ratings? Sam Leader investigates the digital marketplace, a world where unscrupulous traders write their own testimonials and positive reviews can be bought in bulk

The 14 Brits who set off to climb one of New Zealand's highest peaks are down to 10. Having made it to the second base camp, they face a vote-off presided over by host Ben Shephard. As an exhausting snow hike sees the nine remaining climbers tested physically and mentally, call centre worker Sean struggles to keep up, a challenging rope crossing sees influencer Tara forced to find unconventional methods to stay on track, and the Mountain's Keeper sets a dramatic test

Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined in the kitchen by TV presenter and author Julia Bradbury for cooking, chat and craft. Shivi rustles up homemade breakfast muffins, there is a coffee-brewing masterclass with Alice Wainwright, and Jimmy shows how anyone can make a miniature garden wildlife pond. Also on the programme, Shivi visits a wetland area in London for a bird-watching experience and upcycling guru Max McMurdo converts an old door into a garden bench
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

Rob Brydon hosts a game show in which 81 contestants compete in a high-tension battle of knowledge, nerve and strategy. Standing on a vast floor made up of 81 squares, each of which represents a unique category, players go head-to-head in quick-fire duels

Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more
Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective
The key headlines from the day so far

David Dickinson hosts from Bradford in West Yorkshire, where the owner of a gold coin collection hopes he can turn his expensive investment into a profit. Plus, sellers turn down tempting cash offers for a gold medal and old bank notes to take their chances at auction, and local dealer Tim Hogarth offers extra cash to a seller if he can name famous Bradfordians

Ranvir Singh hosts the quiz where Andy and Lorraine, Maisie and Andrew, and Carl and Ashley take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis in an attempt to solve a series of riddles - packed full of confusing conundrums and quick-fire general knowledge questions, only one team can make it through to the high-stakes final of Henry's Riddle Run and earn the chance to win an exciting cash prize as they take on a series of riddles against the clock

Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot
Elaine from the Wirral, Jack from Morecambe, Chloe from Wigan and Nick from Bristol hope they can beat a Chaser together and leave with thousands of pounds. Bradley Walsh asks the questions

Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment
Marlon is furious, while Paddy is determined to help his dad and Kammy and Ross play Cupid
Sam checks his phone for evidence of Megan and Will's affair, Debbie vows to make amends to Carl, and Jodie stirs up trouble at The Kabin

Bradley Walsh hosts as Jane, Jonathan, Chigozie, Michael and Oliver take on the Sinnerman, the Beast, the Governess, the Menace, the Vixen and the Dark Destroyer in the hope of winning thousands of pounds

programmes.show_name: Devil in Disguise: John Wayne Gacy
programmes.show_description: A psychiatrist uncovers Gacy's dark history as Tovar and Kozenczak examine how systems failed to stop his murders, and a romance develops between Billy Kindred and Mary Jane. Drama, starring Michael Chernus and Gabriel Luna

Jonathan is joined by comedian and Celebrity Traitors winner Alan Carr, American actress Neve Campbell, comedian Rob Beckett and his author wife Lou, and actor Archie Madekwe, while there is music by Mumford & Sons
